citation.abstract: Statins, inhibitors of hydroxymethylglutaryl-CoA reductase, reduce the intracellular synthesis of cholesterol and prevent the onset of atherosclerosis. They also decrease the synthesis of isoprenoid molecules, such as the side chain of ubiquinone and geranylgeranyl pyrophosphate. As a consequence, statins impair mitochondrial metabolism and the activation of small monomeric GTPases (such as Rho and Ras), causing toxic effects. To date, a successful strategy to prevent statin toxicity is lacking.
citation.title: Geranylgeraniol prevents the cytotoxic effects of mevastatin in THP-1 cells, without decreasing the beneficial effects on cholesterol synthesis.

facebook.title: Geranylgeraniol prevents the cytotoxic effect... [Br J Pharmacol. 2009] - PubMed - NCBI
facebook.summary:
Geranylgeraniol aka '3,7,11,15-Tetramethyl-(E,E,E)-hexadeca-2,6,10,14-tetraen-1-ol' detected in Lilac CO2 Total. This compound is an intermediate molecule to the biosynthesis of Vitamin E and K. Additionally it acts as a pheromone for Bumblebees!
